alert.note: Alert for Catawba; Cleveland; Greater Burke; Greater Rutherford; Lincoln (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 2:31PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN CATAWBA... NORTHEASTERN RUTHERFORD...WESTERN LINCOLN...NORTHWESTERN CLEVELAND AND SOUTHEASTERN BURKE COUNTIES THROUGH 300 PM EDT... At 231 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Morganton to 13 miles southeast of Marion. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hickory, Newton, Morganton, Conover, Longview, Valdese, Icard, Drexel, Hildebran, and Connelly Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Catawba; Cleveland; Greater Burke; Greater Rutherford; Lincoln
